sen.j: 院派（いんぱ）は、平安時代後期から鎌倉時代の仏師の一派。
sen.e: Inpa refers to one of the busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues) schools from the late Heian Period to the Kamakura Period.
Inpa refers to one of the busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues) schools from the late Heian Period to the Kamakura Period.
Inpa refers to one of the busshi (sculptor of Buddhist Statues) schools from the late Heian Period to the Kamakura Period.

sen.j: 七条大宮仏所、六条万里小路仏所を形成した。
sen.e: They formed Shichijo Omiya Bussho (Buddhist sculpture workshop) and Rokujo Madenokoji Bussho.
They formed Shichijo Omiya Bussho (Buddhist sculpture workshop) and Rokujo Madenokoji Bussho.
They formed Shichijo Omiya Bussho (Buddhist sculpture workshop) and Rokujo Madenokoji Bussho.

sen.j: 祖は、定朝の孫とされる院助。
sen.e: The founder was Injo, who was supposed to be a grandson of Jocho.
The founder was Injo, who was supposed to be a grandson of Jocho.
The founder was Injo, who was supposed to be a grandson of Jocho.

sen.j: 名に院のつく仏師を多数輩出したことから。
sen.e: It derives from the fact that it produced lots of busshi with the name with 'In.'
It derives from the fact that it produced lots of busshi with the name 'In.'

Incho (Hoin, the highest rank among Buddhist priests)
